definition: abbr. for Ukraine 烏克蘭|乌克兰[Wu1 ke4 lan2]/surname Wu
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia
surname Lan/abbr. for Lanzhou 蘭州|兰州[Lan2 zhou1], Gansu
orchid (蘭花|兰花 Cymbidium goeringii)/fragrant thoroughwort (蘭草|兰草 Eupatorium fortunei)/lily magnolia (木蘭|木兰)

sentences.english: But the most powerful legacy of the accident for Ukrainians has been psychological. The U.
sentences.chinese: 但那次核事故对乌克兰人最大的影响一直是心理上的。

sentences.english: The local population traditionally celebrates New Year according to Julian calendar.
sentences.chinese: 传统上，乌克兰人根据儒略历庆祝新年。

sentences.english: The Ukrainian then sent in a cross-shot which Gilardino headed over.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰人接着又为队友传出好球，吉拉迪诺头球顶高。

sentences.english: That was until the Ukrainian knocked Solis – who moved right into the shot – down.
sentences.chinese: 直到乌克兰人击倒了索利斯，他向右移动受到了击打。

sentences.english: The most elaborate eggs are decorated by the people from Poland and Ukraine.
sentences.chinese: 最精心制作彩蛋的是波兰人和乌克兰人。

pinyin: A1 er3 ba1 ni2 ya4 ren2

definition: Moldova/Republic of Moldova, former Soviet republic on the border with Romania
